content.description: This has excellent steep face climbing on big holds. It is the crag classic and probably the best and cleanest moderate sport climb in the Steamboat area.
content.protection: [7] bolts to a [two bolt] anchor just below the lip. This is a bit tricky to set up a toprope from above, it is best to just lead it.
content.location: It is the third route from the left and goes up the center of the crag. Rap down.

content.description: This is an awkward one move wonder that doesn't see much action.
content.protection:
Bolts to an anchor which is shared with

GT's

.
content.location:
It is the 2nd route from the left.

Rap down.

content.description: Climb up to a ledge, through a bulge and into the obvious, twin crack system. Great and sustained climbing with an interesting crux in the middle.
content.protection: Stoppers and a single set of cams to #3. Lower from chains or set up a TR from the bolts on top of the cliff.
content.location:
It is right of

Black Crack

and

West of Africa

.

content.description: Thin face climbing and crystal pinching. Well-placed bolts.
content.protection: Bolts to a bolted anchor which is shared with the route to the right.
content.location: The leftmost bolted route on the crag. Rap down.

content.description: Steeper sport climbing on some big holds. Sustained.
content.protection: Bolts to a bolted anchor, there is also a bolted anchor on the top of the cliff to set up topropes on.
content.location: The rightmost bolted route on the lower crag. Rap down.

content.description: Ascend easy climbing past 3 bolts to a nice ledge with chains. This would be a great beginner lead.
content.location: This route climbs blocky features on the far uphill end of the lower crag.

content.description:
Scrappy and dirty crack climb. Start as for

West of Africa

, go right through a bulge and into the black crack that lies just to the right. At the top cut left to the anchors on

West of Africa

, or top out and go right to the

Twin Cracks

anchors.
content.protection: Cams to #3 and Stoppers. Bolt anchors on other routes.
content.location:
Just right of

West of Africa

. Rap down or build an anchor on the clifftop and hike down.
